intro: Dischidia indragirensis, commonly known as the Indragiri vine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is a climbing plant characterized by its fleshy, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
